data.title: Hungary reports bird flu outbreak on duck farm, WOAH says
data.description:
Hungary reported a first outbreak of highly pathogenic H5N1 bird flu on a farm this season, the World Organisation for Animal Health (WOAH) said on Friday, as Europe faces a swift seasonal upturn in the deadly disease.

The spread of avian influenza, commonly called bird flu, has raised concerns among governments and the poultry industry after it ravaged flocks around the world in recent years, disrupting supply, fuelling higher food prices and raising the risk of human transmission.

Hungary was particularly badly hit by the virus during the 2024/25 season. That flare-up amounted to more than half of the outbreaks recorded on poultry farms in the European Union, with cases mostly detected between end-October and May, official data showed.

The H5N1 virus was detected on Monday in a flock of 19,700 fattening duck in the town of Szolnok, and caused the death of 725 birds, the Paris-based WOAH said, citing a report from the Hungarian authorities. The remaining ducks were subsequently culled as a precaution.

Fattening ducks are mainly used to make foie gras. Hungary is the second largest producer of the luxury food after France.

data.title: The ECB and Fed Are Going in Different Directions. Can It Last?
data.description:
The ECB and Fed Are Going in Different Directions. Can It Last? By Vicky Ge Huang

The European Central Bank held interest rates steady on Thursday, as investors question whether the central bank's most aggressive easing campaign since the financial crisis is really done. The decision came a day after the Federal Reserve cut rates for the second time this year. Meanwhile, the Fed is planning to shrink the number of staff at its banking supervision arm by about one-third by the end of 2026, according to an internal memo seen by The Wall Street Journal. And on the trade front, it still looks like commerce is going to be rocky for years to come as the U.S. and China fail to address their underlying conflicts.

Top News The ECB and Fed Are Going in Different Directions. Can It Last?

The European Central Bank held its key interest rate at 2% , where it has been since June. The central bank cut rates by 2 percentage points in a year before hitting pause over the summer.

The ECB's came a day after the Federal Reserve cut rates. The diverging policy path threatens to complicate the ECB's job by driving up the value of the euro, adding further pressure onto the bloc's exports and inflation.

Eurozone Inflation Slows, Leaving ECB in Its Good Place

Federal Reserve to Reduce Bank Supervision Staff by 30%

Federal Reserve officials are planning to reduce the staff of its banking supervision arm by 30%

by the end of next year, according to an internal memo seen by The Wall Street Journal. The reductions would leave the Fed's supervision and regulation division with about 350 people, down from a previously authorized head count of 500, according to the memo. The cuts were announced by the Fed's new top regulatory official, Vice Chair Michelle Bowman, during a morning meeting.

Economy U.S.-China Truce Brings Little Peace for Firms Caught in Standoff

After a face-to-face with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, President Trump said the meeting wasn't just nice, it was a 12 on a scale of one to 10. But for businesses caught between the two superpowers, the ugly reality remains : The U.S. and China haven't addressed their underlying conflicts

U.S. Halts Trade Blacklist Expansion in Truce With China

Bessent: China to Buy 12 Million Tons of U.S. Soybeans This Season

China Factory Activity Gauge Signals Deepening Manufacturing Gloom

More Home Purchases Are Falling Through in an Uncertain Economy

More home-purchase agreements are being scrapped around the country, reflecting an intensifying standoff between buyers and sellers

in a largely stalled housing market. About 15% of agreements were canceled in September, up from roughly 13.6% a year earlier, according to the real-estate brokerage Redfin.

Cities Across the U.S. Are Putting Robots to Work

Robots are coming to a town near you -deployed by cities to do work that is labor-intensive, repetitive or dangerous for humans. The robots being rolled out in cities are friendly and low-profile-they mow lawns, clean beaches and guide people through buildings, among other things

Japan's Economics Minister Pledges Fiscally Disciplined Stimulus

Japan's government should consider every funding option available to support the economy, but not at the expense of fiscal discipline, the country's new economics minister said. "We won't abandon fiscal discipline," Minoru Kiuchi said in an interview with The Wall Street Journal and other media on Friday. "We will implement fiscal stimulus strategically-not mechanically-while keeping that discipline firmly in mind." In his role as the head of Japan's economic strategy, Kiuchi will be one of the architects of Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's philosophy of "responsible proactive fiscal policy," which he helped devise. Executing that will require reconciling two conflicting goals: ramping up economic stimulus and maintaining fiscal discipline. (Dow Jones Newswires)

Japan Economy Shows Some Strength as Markets Weigh BOJ Hike

Financial Regulation BlackRock Stung by Loans to Firm Accused of 'Breathtaking' Fraud

BlackRock's private-credit investing arm and other lenders are trying to recover hundreds of millions of dollars

after falling victim to what they called a "breathtaking" fraud, marking another breakdown in an opaque corner of the U.S. debt markets.

JPMorgan Tokenizes Private-Equity Fund on Its Own Blockchain

JPMorgan Chase wants to make investing in alternative assets easier

by offering them through digital tokens. The bank said it tokenized a private-equity fund on its blockchain platform, an offering that is available to the wealthy clients served by its private bank.

Forward Guidance Friday (all times ET)

8:30 a.m.: Personal Income and Outlays

8:30 a.m.: Employment Cost Index

9:45 a.m.: Chicago Business Barometer - ISM-Chicago Business Survey - Chicago PMI

Monday

9:45 a.m.: US Manufacturing PMI

10 a.m.: ISM Report On Business Manufacturing PMI

10 a.m.: Construction Spending - Construction Put in Place

11 a.m.: Global Manufacturing PMI

12 p.m.: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly speaks at Forum Club of the Palm Beaches event

4 p.m.: Domestic Auto Industry Sales

Research Fed Might Not Cut Rates Again Until Mid-2026, UniCredit Says

The U.S. Federal Reserve might not cut interest rates until the middle of next year as inflation is likely to move higher and hiring should pick up somewhat while economic activity is solid, analysts at the Investment Institute by UniCredit say in a note. They expect the Fed to pause after Wednesday's decision to cut interest rates was accompanied by what they describe as "notably hawkish" comments. Fed Chair Jerome Powell said a December rate cut was "far from" a foregone conclusion and pointed to deepening divisions among policymakers about how to interpret the outlook. UniCredit's analysts forecast just one more rate cut in mid-2026 and expect that President Trump will be "unable to decisively influence monetary policy." - Jessica Fleetham

Lagarde Hints ECB Could Hold Rates for Some Time

European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde gave the impression at the press conference that it won't lower its key interest rate in the coming months, Commerzbank's Joerg Kraemer says in a note. The case for keeping interest rates stable was reinforced by Lagarde reiterating her statement that the bank is in "a good place" regarding current interest rates, he says. Lagarde noted that risks to the economy have declined due to trade compromises and a ceasefire in the Middle East, though stopped short of describing the overall economic risks as tilted upward. "We continue to expect the ECB to maintain the deposit rate at 2% at least until the end of next year," Kraemer says. - Edward Frankl

Bank of Japan Still Likely to Raise Policy Rate in December

The Bank of Japan is still likely to raise its policy rate by 25 bps in December, DBS Group Research's Ma Tieying says in commentary. Labor unions in Japan are expected to set 2026 wage negotiation targets around November-December, the senior economists says. The Japanese Trade Union Confederation, also known as Rengo, has already signaled a 5% wage increase target for 2026, the same as this year, she says. Also, the likelihood of a BOJ rate hike in December may increase if the Fed holds off on a rate cut at its December meeting, giving the BOJ a window to act that month, the economist adds. - Ronnie Harui

About Us

WSJ Pro Central Banking brings you central banking news, analysis and insights from WSJ's global team of reporters and editors. This newsletter was compiled by markets reporter Vicky Ge Huang in New York. Send your tips, suggestions and feedback to [vicky.huang@wsj.com].

This article is a text version of a Wall Street Journal newsletter published earlier today.

data.title: Swiss Franc's Pullback Likely Driven by Reduced Safe Haven Demand — Market Talk
data.description:
1120 GMT - The Swiss franc's recent pullback likely reflects a reduction in demand for safe havens rather than renewed Swiss National Bank interventions, Commerzbank's Michael Pfister says in a note. The franc's falls sparked speculation that the SNB intervened to curb its strength. However, it's difficult to verify this as estimates based on sight deposit data are often inaccurate and fourth-quarter figures aren't published until March, he says. Moreover, the SNB has repeatedly indicated it would only intervene if the franc moves significantly. Commerzbank's fourth-quarter forecast of 0.92 for the euro versus the franc has been almost reached, and it's "unlikely to fall much further." The franc has fallen in recent days and last trades slightly weaker at 0.9283 per euro. (renae.dyer@wsj.com)

1028 GMT - As U.S. Treasury yields rise, RBC BlueBay Asset Management sees them approaching levels which are attractive enough to buy, says BlueBay CIO Mark Dowding in a note. "Now with yields correcting higher, we would note that 3.75% on 2-year Treasurys and 4.80% on the long end [30-year] could be levels where we may be tempted towards moving to a long duration stance," he says. BlueBay had previously hoped that a continuation of the recent rally would give it the opportunity to add a short trade, but yields failed to reach levels where the asset manager hoped to pull the trigger on this, Dowding says. The two-year Treasury yield is flat at 3.608%, while the 30-year yield is up 2.1 basis point at 4.668%, according to Tradeweb. (emese.bartha@wsj.com)

1026 GMT - China's export growth is likely to remain muted in the near term, according to Citi analysts in a research note. Overall cargo throughput has slowed in the recent weeks and turned negative, as a higher base kicks in, Citi says. "The positive signals from the U.S.-China presidential summit are clearly a sentiment relief, while the immediate economic impact could be smaller," the analysts say. If anything, the tariff reductions could provide some support for China's direct exports to the U.S. in 2026, they add. Citi expects China's exports be flat year-on-year in October. (tracy.qu@wsj.com)

1026 GMT - Eurozone government bond issuance by the largest 11 issuers should fall in November as issuers approach the finish line for this year, says LBBW's Elmar Voelker in a note. "As the end of the year approaches, more government debt managers are reducing or prematurely discontinuing their market presence," the senior fixed income analyst says. As of end-October, sovereigns have completed 91% of their funding needs on average. LBBW forecasts gross issuance of 87 billion euros in November, down from around 114 billion euros in October. (emese.bartha@wsj.com)

0954 GMT - The Bank of England could cut interest rates at the November 6, rate decision due to recent weaker-than-expected U.K. inflation and jobs data released earlier this month, Nomura research analysts say in a note. They expect the decision to be a close call, with five-to-four members voting to lower the bank rate to 3.75%, the analysts say. Markets price in a 31% chance of a BOE rate cut in November, LSEG data show. (miriam.mukuru@wsj.com)

0942 GMT - Sterling and U.K. government bonds would face elevated volatility if U.K. Treasury chief Rachel Reeves unexpectedly resigned, ING's Francesco Pesole says in a note. The opposition is calling for Reeves to resign after she failed to obtain a license to rent out her home but Prime Minister Keir Starmer has backed her and her letting agent has taken responsibility. In July when Reeves appeared close to leaving, gilt fell sharply alongside sterling. Markets are wary that her resignation would "herald more relaxed fiscal rules and additional borrowing at a time when gilt issuance remains elevated." Sterling falls 0.1% to $1.3141, while the euro rises 0.1% to 0.8802 pounds. The 10-year gilt yield rises 2.2 basis points to 4.430%, Tradeweb data show. (renae.dyer@wsj.com)

0931 GMT - Shares in London-listed housebuilders rise after Nationwide's housing-price index report said house prices rose on average 0.3% on-month in October. House prices rose by 231 pounds in the month to an average of 272,226 pounds, as home buyers sit and wait to see what November's budget will bring, RBC Capital Markets analysts Anthony Codling and Oliver Dyson say. "If the housing market is one thing, it is resilient--house prices are at close to all-time highs but mortgage rates more than double where they were before Covid-19, and the prospect of further rate cuts will underpin house prices," RBC says. Shares in Persimmon were up 0.45%, followed by Taylor Wimpey, up 0.4%, and Crest Nicholson, up 0.2%. (anthony.orunagoriainoff@dowjones.com)

0916 GMT - The euro-dollar exchange rate remains driven by dollar moves following the European Central Bank's meeting Thursday, ING's Francesco Pesole says in a note. The ECB left interest rates unchanged, as expected, and gave few signals about future decisions. Price action is led more by Wednesday's Federal Reserve decision, when it cut rates as expected but said another cut in December wasn't a done deal. There's some speculation in the market that the euro could fall below $1.15 but this looks unlikely given prospects of further weak U.S. jobs data, Pesole says. The eurozone economy is also showing a slight improvement, he says. The euro trades steady at $1.1569, having hit a two-week low of $1.1546 Thursday, LSEG data show. (renae.dyer@wsj.com)

0852 GMT - Yields on U.K. government bonds climb, tracking U.S. and eurozone peers, as investors lower expectations of major central banks cutting interest rates in the coming months. This comes after the U.S. Federal Reserve cut interest rates Wednesday but said rates wouldn't necessarily fall in December. Meanwhile, the European Central Bank held rates steady Thursday and pointed to a resilient economy. As U.S. and eurozone rate-cut expectations have fallen, so U.K. rate-cut expectations have also slipped. Money markets price a 62% chance of the Bank of England cutting rates by the end of 2025, down from 72% a week ago, LSEG data show. Ten-year gilt yields climb 2.2 basis points to 4.430%, Tradeweb data show. (miriam.mukuru@wsj.com)

0822 GMT - The relatively calm ECB meeting is still good news for European bank equities, Keefe Bruyette & Woods says in a research note after the central banks held rates at 2% for a third consecutive meeting. "We continue to see loan growth and an upward sloping yield curve as important factors helping bank earnings and the gradual improvement in valuations," analysts write. KBW's earnings forecasts for the continent's banks assume that rates stay at that level until 2028. Another potential 25 basis point cut wouldn't move estimates much given that, as banks increase the resilience of their net interest income, each 25 basis point parallel shift is worth only around 1% of sector earnings. (elena.vardon@wsj.com)

0812 GMT - Bitcoin recovers marginally but remains below the key $110,000 level following losses sustained overnight after a tech-led selloff in U.S. stocks. Tech stocks fell on concerns over increased spending outlooks for Meta and Microsoft. Reduced market bets for another interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve in December following comments at Wednesday's meeting also weighed on risk appetite. Meanwhile, the U.S. and China agreed a trade truce but "structural differences persist, and it's easy for there to be some skepticism of the deal's scope due to the lack of concrete commitments," Deutsche Bank analysts say in a note. Bitcoin rises 1.9% to $109,559 after reaching a one-and-a-half-week low of $106,396 late Thursday, LSEG data show. (renae.dyer@wsj.com)

0742 GMT - Asean looks set to continue benefiting from rising foreign direct investment and fixed investments, as the diversification of the manufacturing supply chain strengthens, Maybank economists and analysts write in a report. FDI in the region have largely held up, despite initial fears that higher U.S. reciprocal tariffs would dampen the region's appeal, they note. U.S. corporates, which are highly dependent on Chinese factories and sales, are facing more pressure to diversify their manufacturing bases given risks of abrupt U.S. tariff rates hike and Chinese authorities' regulatory actions. "Fragmentation of U.S.-China tech supply chains will favor Asean as a more neutral investment destination," Maybank says.(amanda.lee@wsj.com)

VANCOUVER, BC / ACCESS Newswire / October 31, 2025 / Guanajuato Silver Company Ltd. (the "Company" or "GSilver") , a growing Mexican-based precious metals producer, is pleased to announce that further to its successfully completed "bought deal" public offering of 87,000,000 units of the Company (the "Units") at a price of C$0.50 per Unit for gross proceeds of C$43,500,000 (the "Offering"), Canaccord Genuity Corp. and Red Cloud Securities Inc., as co-lead underwriters and joint bookrunners (collectively, the "Underwriters") have purchased an additional 6,525,000 common share purchase warrants (each, a "Warrant") pursuant to their exercise of the over-allotment option (the "Over-Allotment Option") granted by the Company, generating additional gross proceeds to the Company of C$522,000.

Each Warrant will entitle the holder thereof to acquire one common share of the Company at a price of C$0.65 at any time before 5:00 p.m. (Vancouver time) on October 9, 2028.

In consideration for their services in connection with the Over-Allotment Option, the Underwriters received a total cash commission of C$31,320.

About Guanajuato Silver

GSilver is a precious metals producer engaged in reactivating past producing silver and gold mines in central Mexico. The Company produces silver and gold concentrates from the El Cubo Mine, Valenciana Mines Complex, and the San Ignacio Mine; all three mines are located within the state of Guanajuato, which has an established 480-year mining history. Additionally, the Company produces silver, gold, lead, and zinc concentrates from the Topia mine in northwestern Durango. With four operating mines and three processing facilities, Guanajuato Silver is one of the fastest growing silver producers in Mexico.

data.title: Charter Communications 3Q Profit Falls Amid Increased Competition for Internet Subscribers
data.description:
By Nicholas G. Miller

Charter Communications reported lower third-quarter profit as increased competition from fixed wireless and fiber connection hurts its broadband internet business.

The broadband communications company reported net income of $1.14 billion, or $8.34 a share, down from $1.28 billion, or $8.82 a share, the year prior.

Sales fell 0.9% to $13.67 billion. Wall Street expected $13.74 billion, according to FactSet.

Charter is facing increasing competition from fixed wireless and fiber connection services, which are cutting into its home internet subscriber base, but the company is seeing continued gains in its mobile business.

In the third-quarter, total internet customers fell by 109,000, while total mobile lines increased by 493,000.

Meanwhile, the company's TV business is struggling from increased cord-cutting as viewers opt for streaming platforms over traditional TV. But earlier this month, Charter launched a new video app store, which allows customers to activate their streaming apps included in their linear TV subscription. The marketplace is part of a broader strategy to integrate linear TV with streaming, which has slowed the company's video subscriber losses.

The company's total video customers fell 3.5% in the third-quarter. That is a far smaller decline than the 9.5% year-over-year fall in video customers in the third-quarter of last year.

Earlier this month the company said it would lay off 1,200 employees.

Write to Nicholas G. Miller at nicholas.miller@wsj.com.

data.title: Immuneering Initiated at Outperform by Leerink Partners
Bank of New York Mellon Corp SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation, a leading global financial services company specializing in securities services, market and wealth services, and investment and wealth management, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights significant financial and operational achievements, reflecting the company's robust performance and strategic focus on core business segments.

Financial Highlights

Total Revenue: $5,081 million, reflecting a year-over-year increase driven by higher fee and other revenue.

Net Income: $1,457 million, showing a significant improvement from the previous year, attributed to increased total revenue and effective cost management.

Net Income Applicable to Common Shareholders: $1,339 million, indicating strong performance and shareholder value creation.

Basic EPS: $1.90, demonstrating growth in earnings per share compared to the same period last year.

Diluted EPS: $1.88, reflecting the company's ability to generate higher earnings per share on a diluted basis.

Business Highlights

Revenue Segments: The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation's revenue is primarily derived from three business segments: Securities Services, Market and Wealth Services, and Investment and Wealth Management. Each segment contributes to the company's fee and other revenue, with Securities Services and Market and Wealth Services generating significant investment services fees.

Geographical Performance: The wealth management mortgage portfolio shows a strong geographical concentration with 20% in California, 14% in New York, 11% in Florida, and 8% in Massachusetts, indicating a strategic focus on high-net-worth individuals in these regions.

Sales Units: The company reported $23.1 billion in secured margin loans as of September 30, 2025, an increase from $19.1 billion at the end of 2024, reflecting a robust demand for margin lending services.

Future Outlook: The company anticipates continued growth in its core business segments, with a focus on leveraging its investment services and wealth management capabilities to drive future revenue. The recent legislative changes from the One Big Beautiful Bill Act are not expected to have a material impact on the company's financial statements.

SEC Filing: Bank of New York Mellon Corp [ BK ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: 4D Molecular Shares Rise Premarket on Partnership With Otsuka
data.description:
By Colin Kellaher

Shares of 4D Molecular Therapeutics moved higher in premarket trading Friday after the biotechnology company said it formed a partnership potentially worth hundreds of millions of dollars with Japan's Otsuka Pharmaceutical.

4D late Thursday said it will grant Otsuka exclusive rights to develop and commercialize its 4D-150 drug candidate for retinal vascular diseases, including wet age-related macular degeneration and diabetic macular edema, in Japan, China, Australia and other Asia-Pacific markets.

4D said it will receive an $85 million upfront cash payment from Otsuka and expects to receive at least $50 million of cost sharing from its partner over the next three years for development activities supporting global registration.

The Emeryville, Calif., company said it is also eligible to receive up to $336 million in regulatory and commercial milestone payments, along with royalties on product sales.

4D shares, which closed Thursday at $11.32, were recently up 10% to $12.49 in premarket trading.

Write to Colin Kellaher at colin.kellaher@wsj.com

data.title: J-Power to shut two coal-fired power plants, committed to offshore wind project
data.description:
By Yuka Obayashi

Japan's Electric Power Development (J-Power) said on Friday it will decommission two coal-fired power plants by March 2029 as part of efforts to meet its 2030 goal of cutting carbon dioxide emissions by 46% from 2013 levels.

President Hitoshi Kanno also reaffirmed the company's commitment to completing the Oga-Katagami-Akita offshore wind project in northern Akita prefecture under Japan's second-round public auction framework.

J-Power, a wholesale electricity supplier, relies on coal-fired generation for over half of its domestic sales.

The units slated for closure are No.1 and No.2 units at the Takasago thermal power station in western Hyogo prefecture, subcritical-pressure plants that began operation in 1968 and 1969, each with a 250-megawatt capacity.

  • "To achieve our 2030 target, we must shut down remaining inefficient thermal units, but we also must maintain supply capacity
  • we will decide through discussions with the authorities," Kanno said.

He cited the 700-MW No.3 unit at Takehara in western Hiroshima prefecture, and the 1,000-MW No.1 unit at Matsuura in southern Nagasaki prefecture as candidates for future closures.

Shutting these, in addition to the two Takasago units, would reduce the utility's domestic capacity by 12%.

Japan's power demand is projected to rise due to growing electricity needs from data centres and semiconductor plants, reversing years of decline.

Kanno said Japan must accelerate renewable energy deployment, particularly offshore wind, to achieve both carbon neutrality and energy security.

Offshore wind developers face global headwinds from rising material, equipment and labour costs. With Mitsubishi Corp withdrawing from three first-round auction projects, uncertainty looms over Japan's offshore wind market.

"But we are pushing ahead with our Katagami project despite rising costs," Kanno said.

A consortium of JERA, J-Power, Itochu and Tohoku Electric Power aims to start operations of the Oga-Katagami-Akita project in autumn 2028, using Vestas' wind turbines, Kanno said.

The government is reviewing bidding rules for the reopening of the first-round auction, but any decisions should apply retroactively to second- and third-round projects, Kanno said.

data.title: TXNM Energy Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
data.description:
TXNM Energy, an energy holding company based in Albuquerque, New Mexico, has released its financial results for the third quarter of 2025. The company, which delivers energy to over 800,000 homes and businesses across Texas and New Mexico through its regulated utilities, TNMP and PNM, has provided a detailed overview of its performance and strategic initiatives in its latest SEC 8-K filing.

Financial Highlights

For the third quarter of 2025, TXNM Energy reported GAAP earnings of $1.22 per diluted share, a decrease from $1.45 per diluted share in the same period of 2024. Ongoing earnings were $1.33 per diluted share, slightly down from $1.43 per diluted share in the third quarter of 2024. The company's GAAP net earnings attributable to TXNM Energy were $130.7 million, compared to $131.2 million in the third quarter of 2024. Ongoing net earnings were $142.8 million, up from $129.3 million in the same period last year.

Business and Operational Highlights

TXNM Energy's third quarter results reflect the implementation of the first phase of approved rates in New Mexico and newly approved transmission recovery in Texas. The company also issued additional equity during the quarter. Segment-wise, PNM, the vertically integrated electric utility in New Mexico, reported GAAP diluted EPS of $0.95, down from $1.20 in Q3 2024. TNMP, the electric transmission and distribution utility in Texas, reported GAAP diluted EPS of $0.38, slightly down from $0.39 in the same period last year.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

One of the significant developments for TXNM Energy is the proposed acquisition by Blackstone Infrastructure. The transaction, valued at $61.25 per share, was approved by shareholders on August 28, 2025. The acquisition is subject to regulatory approvals and is expected to close in the second half of 2026. Additionally, TXNM Energy's TNMP had its second Transmission Cost of Service (TCOS) filing for 2025 approved, providing recovery for $87 million of rate base. PNM also filed an application for a Certificate of Convenience and Necessity (CCN) to construct, own, and operate 30 megawatts of energy storage.

Management's Perspective

Don Tarry, President and CEO of TXNM Energy, commented on the results, stating, "Third quarter results incorporate the implementation of the first phase of approved rates in New Mexico and newly approved transmission recovery in Texas, along with additional equity issued during the quarter. We have initiated the regulatory approval process for our transaction with Blackstone Infrastructure with filings that address the key issues raised during our conversations with local stakeholders and community groups."

Future Outlook

TXNM Energy has not affirmed its previously issued earnings guidance for 2025 and does not plan to issue revised earnings guidance during the pending transaction with Blackstone Infrastructure. The company continues to anticipate the closing of the acquisition in the second half of 2026, subject to regulatory approvals and customary closing conditions.

Original SEC Filing: TXNM ENERGY INC [ TXNM ] - 8-K - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: Church & Dwight Co., Inc. Q3 2025 Financial Results
data.description:
Church & Dwight Co., Inc., a leading U.S. producer of sodium bicarbonate and a wide range of personal care, household, and specialty products, has released its Q3 2025 financial results. The company reported strong performance across several key financial metrics, driven by innovation, marketing, and sales execution.

Financial Highlights

For the third quarter of 2025, Church & Dwight reported net sales of $1.586 billion, a 5.0% increase from the same period last year. Organic sales grew by 3.4%, with domestic sales up by 2.3% and international sales by 7.7%. The company achieved a reported EPS of $0.75, compared to a loss of $0.31 in Q3 2024, and an adjusted EPS of $0.81, marking a 2.5% increase. Cash from operations surged by 19.6% to $435.5 million.

Business and Operational Highlights

The Domestic Division saw a 2.3% organic growth, led by products like THERABREATH™ mouthwash, HERO™ acne products, ARM & HAMMER™ Cat Litter, and TROJAN™ condoms. The International Division experienced a 7.7% organic growth, driven by broad-based share gains across subsidiaries and the Global Markets Group. The Specialty Products Division also performed well, with a 4.2% organic sales growth.

Notably, the company increased its marketing investment by 50 basis points to 12.8% of net sales, further driving consumption and share gains. E-commerce sales continued to grow, representing 23% of total consumer sales in Q3 2025, up from 21% last year.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

Church & Dwight is on track to exit the FLAWLESS™, SPINBRUSH™, and WATERPIK™ showerhead businesses by early 2026. The company is also conducting a strategic review of its vitamin business, exploring options such as streamlining the supply chain, new JV/partnership opportunities, and potential divestitures. Additionally, the company repurchased $300 million of shares in Q3, bringing the year-to-date total to $600 million.

Management's Perspective

CEO Rick Dierker expressed satisfaction with the company's performance in a challenging environment, highlighting the balanced portfolio of value and premium products and a strong focus on innovation. He noted that the first quarter of ownership of TOUCHLAND exceeded initial expectations and emphasized the company's commitment to driving market share gains through innovation and marketing investments.

Future Outlook

Looking ahead, Church & Dwight has raised its full-year outlook for several key metrics. The company now expects net sales growth of approximately 1.5%, adjusted gross margin contraction of 40 basis points, and adjusted EPS of approximately $3.49. Cash from operations is projected to reach around $1.2 billion. For Q4 2025, the company anticipates reported sales growth of approximately 3.5% and adjusted EPS of approximately $0.83 per share.

Original SEC Filing: CHURCH & DWIGHT CO INC /DE/ [ CHD ] - 8-K - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: HONKARAKENNE SIGNED A STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT WITH SAIPRO GROUP LLC IN UZBEKISTAN
data.description:
HONKARAKENNE OYJ  STOCK EXCHANGE RELEASE INVESTOR NEWS 31 October 2025 at 13:15

HONKARAKENNE SIGNED A STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT WITH SAIPRO GROUP LLC IN UZBEKISTAN

Honkarakenne and SAIPRO GROUP LLC Signed Agreement on a Strategic Partnership to Further Develop the Green Hills Premium Resort and Santa Claus Park among other planned and envisioned resorts in Uzbekistan. The total value of the signed five-year contract is around 15 million euros.

The expansion represents the next phase in a successful partnership focused on high-quality, sustainable resort development in Central Asia. Over the next five years, the two companies will collaborate on the design, manufacturing, delivery, and construction of new climate-conscious wooden facilities at various resorts.

The President and CEO of Honkarakenne, Mr. Marko Saarelainen, comments the contract as follows: “This agreement reflects our commitment to bring Finnish wooden construction excellence to Uzbekistan as well as to new markets in Central Asia and to support sustainable tourism and premium living concepts in the area.”

Chairman of the Supervisory Board of SAIPRO GROUP LLC, Mr. Ravshankhon Djuraev, comments the contract as follows: “Together with our Finnish partner, we are shaping a modern and environmentally responsible resort destination in Uzbekistan — combining natural comfort, innovation, and quality.”

The agreement was signed in Tashkent on October 31 during the official visit of President of Finland Alexander Stubb to Uzbekistan. The signing ceremony was organized in conjunction with the Business Forum that was part of the official visit. The Green Hills Premium Resort project represents a new stage in Finnish–Uzbek cooperation, where advanced wood construction technologies meet the growing demand for sustainable development in the region.

For further information; Marko Saarelainen, President and CEO, tel. +358 40 542 0254, . marko.saarelainen@honka.com

Images and materials:

https://honka.mediabank.fi/fi/collection/view_share_link/3889a5c3234608140cb5f41208fa0e87

HONKARAKENNE OYJ

Marko Saarelainen

President and CEO

DISTRIBUTION Nasdaq OMX Helsinki Ltd Principal media Finnish Financial Supervisory Authority www.honka.fi

Honkarakenne Oyj manufactures high-quality, healthy and ecological log homes, holiday homes and public buildings under its Honka® brand from Finnish solid wood. The company has delivered 90,000 buildings to over 50 countries. House kits are manufactured in Finland, the company's own factory is located in Karstula. In 2024, Honkarakenne Group's net sales were EUR 36.7 million, of which exports accounted for 29 %. www.honka.com

data.title: Asset manager WisdomTree's Q3 profit beats on record AUM
data.description:
Overview

  • WisdomTree Q3 operating revenue beats analyst expectations, driven by higher average AUM

  • Adjusted EPS for Q3 beats consensus, reflecting strong operational performance

  • Company reports record AUM of $137.2 bln, driven by net inflows and market appreciation

Outlook

  • Company did not provide specific financial guidance for future quarters or full year

Result Drivers

  • RECORD AUM - Co reports record AUM of $137.2 bln, an 8.8% increase from prior qtr driven by market appreciation and net inflows

  • NET INFLOWS - $2.2 bln net inflows primarily from commodity, cryptocurrency, and international developed equity products

  • HIGHER REVENUES - 11.5% increase in operating revenues due to higher average AUM and increased revenues from European ETPs
